entries.meaning: A sheet of material (originally silk but now synthetic) with areas that are porous to ink and others that are non-porous to allow printing of images, such as on T-shirts.

verbs.description: silkscreen (third-person singular simple present silkscreens, present participle silkscreening, simple past and past participle silkscreened)

entries.meaning: To use a silkscreen to apply an image.
